intro: Casearia contracta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf casearia, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and elliptical in shape. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, capsule-like fruits. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
